San Lorenzo High School Student Wins Essay Contest!
Gracy Mora, Senior at San Lorenzo High School, won the first place award in a statewide writing contest sponsored by CABE, The California Association of Bilingual Educators.
The California Association for Bilingual Education (CABE) is a non-profit organization promoting bilingual education and quality educational experiences for all students in California since 1976. Each year at the annual conference, CABE recognizes outstanding students through its essay contest. This year’s essay theme was “How does being multilingual/multicultural inspire you?” Gracy has presented her essay at our District English Learner Advisory Council (DELAC) meeting, and has been invited to speak at our district’s Annual DELAC Awards event later this spring. Congratulations to Gracy!

Attention educators! Check out AC Boost, Alameda County's new home down payment assistance program. The program offers shared equity loans of up to $150,000 to first-time homebuyers who live, work or have been displaced from Alameda County.

Educators in Alameda County may have double the chance to access AC Boost funds. Those qualified as educators include full-time teachers, administrators, school district employees and staff members working for any Alameda County K-12 public school, community college or public university. Additional qualifications include full-time licensed child-care providers and educators working in licensed residential facilities for children/foster youth.
